meanings.definition: To give all or a large part of one's time or resources to a person, activity, or cause.
meanings.sent1: She decided to devote her weekends to volunteering at the animal shelter.
meanings.sent2: He devoted his energy to studying for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent3: The little girl wanted to devote all her allowance to buying candy.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music led him to devote every spare moment to practicing the guitar.
meanings.sent5: The chef would devote hours perfecting his signature dish.

meanings.definition: To dedicate or consecrate something to a deity or sacred purpose.
meanings.sent1: The priest will devote the new church altar during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: They devoted the temple to the goddess of wisdom.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to devote their treehouse to their secret club meetings.
meanings.sent4: The artist would devote each painting to a different muse for inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual required them to devote the sacred ground to the spirits of nature.
